Data_type.0: L3>Level 3 electron pitch angles from 3d data

Logical_source_description.0: Solar Orbiter Level 2 Phase Space Density (PSD) of Nominal Mode Pitch Angle Data (NMPAD) from Solar Wind Analyser (SWA) Electron Analyser System (EAS)

Rules_of_use.0: Current best quality data - see caveats file or contact SWA/EAS team for information on use

Data_product.0: nmpad-psd>nm3d L2 psd data binned into pitch angles

Acknowledgement.0: Solar Orbiter is a space mission of international collaboration between ESA and NASA, operated by ESA Solar Orbiter Solar Wind Analyser (SWA) data are derived from scientific sensors which have been designed and created, and are operated under funding provided in numerous contracts from the UK Space Agency (UKSA), the UK Science and Technology Facilities Council (STFC), the Agenzia Spaziale Italiana (ASI), the Centre National d'etudes Spatiales (CNES, France), the Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique (CNRS, France), the Czech contribution to the ESA PRODEX programme and NASA.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Epoch in nano-seconds since J2000, encoded as terrestrial time on rotating Earth Geoid

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: The EAS time tag is from the center of the acquisition interval which is 1 sec

VarAttributes.CATDESC: Electron pitch angle data, both EAS1 and EAS2 combined - Phase Space Density
---> Spectrograms by sector at sample energies
---> Spectrograms by energy at sample sectors
Ratio of PSD between EAS1 and EAS2 sensors
The Electron pitch angles derived from 3D data and calibrated magnetic field data in PSD units
Upper half width of pitch angle bin
Lower half width of pitch angle bin
The representative centre energy for the accumulation bin
Upper half width of energy bin
Lower half width of energy bin
Number of magnetic field vectors used in averaging

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Holds number of magnetic field vectors used for averaging.

VarAttributes.CATDESC: PAD variation Quality score for BM event

VarAttributes.VAR_NOTES: Represents the variation of the magnetic field in degrees as a flag defined in the data description documents.
This bitwise variable is used to indicate EAS data quality in detail. Details not finalized yet.
